intro: Zygomeris flava, commonly known as the yellow zygomeris, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Zygophyllaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America, particularly in the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant is characterized by its yellow flowers, which are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. It has adapted to harsh environments with its deep root system and succulent leaves that store water. Zygomeris flava plays a role in stabilizing soils and providing forage for wildlife in its native habitat.
